intro: Royena galpinii, commonly known as the Galpin's roya, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native habitat.
